Reviews.Title: “Absolute good value for money but no indoor kids corner as it is mentioned”
Reviews.Author: shelman_10
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Room, beds, breakfast, coffee (excellent). Only one thing was disappointing, the kids corner was only two tables with wooden toys and a bookcase with italian kids books.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for All”
Reviews.Author: Ryan D
Reviews.Content: Novotel Mestre was perfect for us to go to Venice. This hotel was perfect for us because the first time we arrived here we can check in early at 9.00am. Registration very fast and the reception staff inform us about bus stop closed to the hotel. 4-5 minutes walking. Free Parking at the hotel, but if u not sure about security, can pay the parking inside with 6 Euro per night. Swimming pool not operated because it was winter. Free wifi, 2 computer available at lobby. 200 meter from hotel there's a Lidl Supermarket, you can buy something there. Before arriving at the hotel we bought ACTV unlimited ride for bus and water taxi at the airport for 12 hours journey 16 Euro each, 24 hours journey 18 Euro. If already have a planned, it's better to book online at ACTV website, very easy and have a discount. After book online, we can go to the airport to collect the ticket from vending machine. The ACTV unlimited card also included bus ticket from bus stop near hotel to Venice. So, it's better to collect the ticket at the airport before arriving at the hotel. Room and bath room very clean, had a heater. No worry getting cold at night. It was very convenience stay here before we went to Venice and will be stay here some day.

Reviews.Title: “Back again for second visit”
Reviews.Author: Ballinora4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time in February 2012, this time I brought my family and we visited Venice. The hotel is modern and spotlessly clean. Bedrooms very comfortable, and they have interconnecting rooms. The price was very good for this high standard of accommodation. Breakfast buffet was really good, although the staff start clearing away the food *immediately* at the end of the breakfast period, which is a little annoying. We ate just once at the bar, when we ordered pizza which to be honest was really poor. We also ordered room service for dinner one evening, and although the food quality was good, the portions were very small, main courses were more like starters! Location is right off the highway which is great if you are driving. From there to Venice took us about 15-20 minutes driving, but there is also a public bus service (about 10 mins walk from the hotel). Check in and checkout tends to be slow.

Reviews.Title: “Where all the Aussies stay!”
Reviews.Author: fima m
Reviews.Content: Situated in quite a good spot however still a 15 inure bus ride from the canals. Please note you need to have pre purchased bus tickets to use the bus. The hotel has free apple macs to use. It wash good set out.the only downfall is, it's very busy. But the rooms are comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be extremely customer friendly. The staff was extremely courteous and ready to offer any information or help whenever asked for. The staff was also flexible in according certain requests. The hotel was also children friendly with a children video game counter at the reception. Also, the pull out sofa was big enough to accomodate 2 kids. Would surely love to go back?

Reviews.Title: “Good Price for hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While a little away from the city, it has a good bus network to get you into the city. A typical business type hotel with the usual amenities. Staff was helpful and free wi-fi in the lobby area only. I would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “MIDDLE OF NOWHERE - WITH BAD FOOD”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover34996
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertised in our tour package as "centrally located" was in the middle of nowhere which left you with virtually stranded in place. Our room's rug looked like a fraternity house living room after a weekend beer bash with stains and dirty spots everywhere. The food in the hotel's dining room was awful, consisting of bland starch on starch with virtually no taste. When I complained about the condition of the room I was told that there were no other rooms available and no effort was made to correct the condition.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable. Breakfasts Yuk.”
Reviews.Author: tomDubbo_Australia
Reviews.Content: The location was away from Venice tourist honeypot, but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. Breakfasts were on par with Italian hotels, poor with watery tasteless eggs (tasted like they were left over from the morning before). Why can't Italian hotels serve decent coffee and a decent breakfasts?

Reviews.Title: “Good Spacious & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Sheldon A
Reviews.Content: The â€œNovotel Venezia Mestreâ€� is a four star hotel that is at quite a distance from Old Venice or Venezia as it is popularly known by the locals. There is ample parking at the back of the hotel for no charge at all and is un-monitored. In addition the hotel has another car park in front of the hotel and charge about 5 euros for a 24 hours parking limit which is monitored by security cameras. The rooms of the hotel are pretty clean and well arranged. There is an electric kettle with a handful of tea and coffee sachets too. The room also has a 32 inch LCD television with a decent amount of English channels. I although found the cushioning of the bed to be on the softer side and you almost sunk into the bed. I would although like to add that should you wish to go to Old Venice using Public transport then please make sure you leave the hotel early in the morning and plan your itinerary to be back in the hotel before 8:00 pm as there is no transportation back to the hotel from Old Venice after this time, it takes approximately 30 minutes by Public Transport from the bus stop near â€œNovotel Venezia Mestreâ€� to â€œPiazzale Romaâ€�. Although there are other bus services that run pretty late, they may drop you at quite a distance from the hotel and you may have to walk to the hotel for about a kilometer, the streets are pretty lonely and deserted at this part of the night and the hotel staff also informed me of some muggings that take place during this part of the night when they saw me walk in at 8:45 pm. I guess I had a lucky escape! The restaurant on the ground floor was decent; while options available were not ample there was quite a typical selection of cold meats. I must although say that the restaurant staff were more than friendly and would probably smile if you paid them to do that. Overall if you are looking for a clean and quite place to stay in, I would recommend this hotel to you. Besides for travellers who are driving this is probably one of the best options as it is right next to the Autostrade (Expressway).

Reviews.Title: “Venice in the rain”
Reviews.Author: Johanhimself
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, one room. In october. During our stay the Venice weather was real bad, rain all day and night. Still no problem drying our soaked gear in the hotel room without creating damp conditions, excellent ventilation! Room was good and clean, everything in good working order. For us, travelling with two young teenage children, Novotel is almost always a very good offer (Children stay in same room, no charge for extra bed an no charge for the extra breakfasts). Breakfast was good, efficient, plenty of everything fruit and drinks and it was three times a party for our girls (and an attack on my BMI.) Wifi in the lounge is free and real fast, also two two apple computers there for free. Did not test the wifi in the room (must be paid extra). The hotel turned out to be a good place for us, busstop into the Venice we came for is only a few hunderd meters away, Lidl shop at the busstop. Two points it can improve on: 1. We had one diner in the restaurant, the waiters were somewhat strangely stressed, making the atmosphere not relaxt. The food was nice enough and certainly not expensive. 2. A must to improve on: The extra bed for the children (=the unfolded sofa) had a bad matrass and the bed linnen was too smal for the matrass size. That meant trouble during the sleeping hours. A few times a night all the turning in the extra bed woke up the children and daddy. Daddy had to get out his comfortable bed to get the children coverred with bedlinnen again. It slept so bad that our youngest almost preferred sleeping on the floor. Conclusion: good place to stay and certainly worth the price we had to pay. Comparred to other Novotels we visited* over the years it's not the best we met. The extra bed really is substandard. (*Novotel can do better, as we expirenced in the excellent Leipzig Novotel a year ago).

Reviews.Title: “The long wait”
Reviews.Author: freelancer2000 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location away from Venice easily accessed by local bus , taxi and train. The area were this hotel fulls down is in service and food quality. If you like to wait a lextremely ong time for a very poor attempt at italian cooking, then eat at the resturant, my advise is order a bottle of wine at the bar because you will be on your second bottle before you get any food and you want to be on the way to being drunk for whats been served.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay outside Venice”
Reviews.Author: vanjacobson Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want a good place to stay outside Venice, this is it. Good infrastructure, trained personnel (good english spoken), good food at a reasonable price. The place is near piazzela roma (if you are driving) which makes a good station for eventual trips to the island.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Venice Mestre September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Travellerofold Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after taking train to Venice Mestre. Taxi from the station is about 10 Euro, but got the impression he took a roundabout route. On the way back we took the bus which is a lot cheaper. Hotel staff are not as friendly or helpful as other Accor premises. Bus into Venice is a short walk and frequent and there is also a bus to the Mestre Station. Best thing about the hotel is a 20 minute walk into Mestre where there is an excellent restaurant near the roundabout. Has a pool, but closed as of September 15th. They advertised a Coffee and pastry special, but was told not available till 7.30am Breakfast at far greater cost is from 6.30am. Bar is a nice area to relax, indoors or out doors. Hotel has a lot of bus tour groups like Cosmos etc. Tea/coffee making available in the room.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: 66Paul Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A good location just outside of Venezia particularly if you are driving. Right beside the autostrada so very easy to get in and out. The bus stop to get you to Venezia is only a short walk. Mestre town and restaurants are also walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Tour Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiger96_nz
Reviews.Content: Bad start to our stay with the porters mixing up all the tour bags. Found the bar/pool area was really relaxing. Rooms were large with tea/coffee making facilities. Restaurant breakfasts were great. Pool even has a lifeguard for the children!

Reviews.Title: “Free wifi, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Angels45069
Reviews.Content: Staff wouldn't or couldn't speak English. Free wifi too weak to effectively use. Hotel was clean and well maintained. Breakfast good, dinner just ok. Too far from Venice.

Reviews.Title: “our stay was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean, the employers very kind, the breakfast fantastic, the bus station for Venezia near the hotel. We were satisfied and we recomanded the hotel to a couple which visited Venezia last week

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, shame about everything else.”
Reviews.Author: Moo o
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a business trip for 2 nights. 1st night: Arrived 10.00 p.m. and ordered food and drink from the bar because restaurant was closed. Lasagna arrived which was cold and returned. Lasagna No.2 also cold and returned. Lasagna No.3 arrived warm, was returned, and re-served with tell tale spatter at the edge of the plate from microwave-ing. I have to say it is the worst tasting Lasagna have ever eaten, devoid of any discernible flavor other than what seemed like 4 times more salt than is normally regarded healthy for a human's daily consumption. This 'meal' appeared to have been the poorest, cheapest, frozen ready meal known to man. Without a doubt inferior to the ones sold for 99p in my local convenience store. Big disappointment for first culinary experience in Italy. Shocking that they charged 16 euros for it - and could not even be bothered to check it if was warm before serving! Fold down bed was uncomfortable. Air conditioning had 2 options: Noisy and ineffective, or Very noisy and ineffective. Shower: Boiler not capable of suppling demand. Hot water only available at off peak times. Breakfast: reasonable. Bacon and mini sausages very salty, accompanied by strange yellow gelatinous lumps, which I deduced may have once been eggs at some time in the past before they were dried, powdered, then re-hydrated and warmed up. (But only just above room temperature). Coffee: Necafe capsule machine. (In Italy WTF!). Swimming Pool: looked nice, but was closed. Internet was slow, involved laborious registration process, and caused facebook to lock me out of my account. Transport to venice: choice of 40 euro taxi or long walk along motor-way hard shoulder to bus/train station. Did not know about non-existent shuttle bus until I read other reviews here. Billing: Our rooms were pre-paid by company. The checkout desk lost this info and tried to charge us again for the rooms when we tried to pay our bar bill. We had to get our boss to phone them to sort it out. This caused a nail biting 20 minute delay for us to get too our airport taxi waiting outside. Some staff surly, which is understandable because they must be both poorly paid, and ashamed of having to serve such terrible food. But honestly, how much do you have to not give a dam, to be able to serve a 'dinner' cold, not once, but 3 times!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is clean and service was fine.”
Reviews.Author: Chadsta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine if you don't want to stay on Veniec island. Mestre city centre is probably about a 20 min walk from the hotel. The bus stop to Venice is about 100m from the hotel. The busses run every half hour (from memory, 23 past and 53 past the hour) But the biggest downside is that the direct busses stop around 7:30pm from Venice. There are other busses you can catch, but you will need to get off at Mestre, and either walk (about 20mins) or catch another bus back to the stop. They provide free internet service, but are given login cards (3 Hour) and recharge cards (1 Hour).. This was rather annoying as you had to authenticate every time you needed to check something online. We caught a Taxi from Marco Polo Airport to the hotel, and the cost was â‚¬45. It seems close-is to the air port, but is about 12 mile drive. You could possibly catch a bus to Mestre from the airport and then walk or catch another bus closer to the hotel. Although the hotel is fine, and well kept, personally next time I would stay on Venice Island.The full trip to Venice from the Hotel is about 40 minutes. the hotel is well priced for the service and the resonably spacious rooms. I had the breakfast one morning (cost â‚¬12p.p) which i would not recommend. The food was ok but over priced. Breakfast included bacon, scrambled eggs and toasts. The coffee was good. The hotel included a nice pool, which we didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Vinther75
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here at a very low price due to a special summer campaign. Very nice and big rooms, great comfort and a fine swimmingpool in the backyard. Though a bit far from Venezia, you can easily reach the magnificent city by public transportation, which is fairly cheap. Receptionists are all very helpful in any way. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location terrible service terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: 2under2kids
Reviews.Content: Staff was terrible 10 min to get bar service even then staff member twice spilt on himself 2 separate nights traveling with 2 small children and cleanliness and room setup great but want advice on food breakfast ok dinner below average Do not pre pay as if want early checkout lose your money so stuck Internet constantly needs to be recharged every 3 hours until last day when the gave me a ten hour recharge card If you need two Internet connections ie ( 2 I Phones) staff are not to happy to help Seriously unlike any novatel have ever stayed in and seriously let down to a great chain

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: JTFKRF Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel with proximity to Venice and Novotel delivered. With Eu 1,30 was able to catch the bus across the causeway into town and from there, transportation was a breeze. The hotel staff was very accomodating to our needs and I found the rooms to be clean, comfortable and quiet. Would have been very pleased to stay longer. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average at most...”
Reviews.Author: Nomad77_11
Reviews.Content: Average Novotel. Rooms are not bad, regular Novotel, however... - Location. Don't even think about staying here if you don't have a car. Located in far north of Mestre, it's not near to anything. Your options are: Bus to Venice - long, crowded, very tiring after a long day and station not near the hotel; Bus to Mestre train station, train is a very nice ride for 1 Euro but the station is too far from the hotel, not walkable at all so you have to rely on the bus again. If you do have a car, prepare to pay for parking both at the hotel and train station. I did pay for "attended" hotel parking but it didn't feel safe, the ramp was up most of the times so what's the point anyways... - Breakfast was very disappointing. If I recall correctly around 10 Euros, but consisted of dry croissants, orange juice and some coffee. Chose to eat breakfast in small cafes in Mestre instead, before boarding the train. - Expect big crowds. Hotel caters to tour groups, so don't be surprised to see 3 buses arriving just before you. Loooong check in, check out, and generally everything is crowded, loud, touristy and not too romantic, spoils the feeling after being for the day in such a beautiful town. - Internet is not free, or put it this way, you can have bad quality wireless in the room at a big cost, almost a rip-off. Only spot for free internet is in the lobby, but only with 2 workstations, so yes, you've guessed correctly: it's impossible to get to them because it's overcrowded. Not a very good thing because to plan well your following day in Venice, internet is essential. Conclusion: If you decide to stay in mainland Venice, there are way better options and other places to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Venice by public transport.”
Reviews.Author: Victho Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you wish to stay off the island of Venice and travel with public transport this is a good hotel too stay at. The public bus is a 5 minute walk from the hotel and takes you directly there for a small fee. The hotel is clean and modern and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel but location not great”
Reviews.Author: Jenni G
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our late 50's and this is my first visit to Italy. We are having a wonderful time and the hotel and staff have been fantastic. Big room, lovely pool area and it is clearly geared to suit families as there is a play area etc for children. The staff have been fantastic especially Pallabe from the bar and Marco from the restaurant. I have Coeliac's Disease and have to be gluten free. The hotel has a separate gluten free menu and I had fantastic GF pasta. We were made to feel like people rather than just another guest by both Pallabe and Marco particularly. The pool is cleaned eevry day and there is a life guard on duty and the room was spotless. The location is unfortunately in the middle of nowhere beside a motorway (there is double glazing on the windows which you can also open) but it is only a short walk to a small supermarket and the bus stop to Venice itself. If you can't afford to stay in Venice itself this is a great choice - especially if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelfan69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for 1 night in August, purpose was to visit Venice. As it was pretty difficult to find a good hotel at a reasonable price in Venice we searched through the internet and found this hotel. Location is great, rate was great, room + amenities OK, breakfast also. What I liked although we did not use it was the outdoor pool......I can absolutely recommend this place when visiting Venice without spending that much money for accommodation...

Reviews.Title: “Double payment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am visiting Novotels for twenty years. But first time i had to pay "preautorizzazione" in amount of the whole price, i.e. I had my credit blocked for two weeks with doubled payment. Only today was my card unblocked. I donÂ´t want to pay "prautorizzazione" in Novotels anymore !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but out of the way for tourists”
Reviews.Author: AwesomAndy
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice hotel to stay in, with free wifi at the lobby. The room I had was quite large, although partly faces the highway. However, it was not possible to hear noises from the traffic. It's quite a distance away from everything else though.

Reviews.Title: “short break in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and efficient. The room was fine and the children enjoyed the pool. The only disappointment was in the hotel information it stated that there was a hotel shuttle bus to Venice. This was not the case and you had to walk a short way along the dual carriageway to the tobaconist to buy a bus ticket to travel on a public bus. This bus also stopped running at 8.o.clock pm and we wanted to spend the evening in venice so had to get a taxi back to the hotel which cost 30euro.

Reviews.Title: “Pre and Post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dawnWaterlooville
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this hotel both Pre and Post cruise. It is like an airport hotel surrounded by roads but you do not hear the traffic at all even when using the pool. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the rooms were spacious and very clean. The bed was lovely and comfortable on both stays and the meals were excellent. The pool is very welcoming after a hot day in Venice. Also you can walk into Mestre town which has a lovely Piazza in about 15 minutes but this does mean walking under an underpass which could put some people off. Lidl is just round the corner as are the bus stops. Internet is free in the lobby. They also have a courtesy room for suitcases. Check out time is 12pm which is very useful if you have a later flight. The reception staff will quite happily call a taxi for you if you do not want to use local transport which is actually very efficient. TRANSPORT TO AND FROM HOTEL We got a taxi from Marco Polo airport for 90 euros return which we prebooked. This hotel is ideal for staying close to Venice if you don't want to stay in the centre. It takes about 30 minutes to get into Venice either by getting bus H1 to Mestre Railway Station then bus 2 to Venice or you can get a direct Venezia bus. The tickets are sold at the hotel for 1.20 euros. You can also get a bus to Lido De Jesolo from Mestre bus station for 7 euros return which takes about an hour, this bus also stops at Marco Polo Airport. To get back to the hotel from the Mestre station you need bus H2. You can also get a bus from Venice direct back to Lidl but you do not get this bus from Piazza Roma, you get on the small monorail across the road (1 euro) which goes to the Tronchetto, it's 2 stops, the first stop is the Marittima cruise port and the next one is the final stop. Walk to the right when exiting and cross the road to find the Preganziol bus. We also got a regional train to Verona which took about 2 hours for 15 euros return. If you do this do not get off at Verona Puerto Vescuvo which is the first Verona Station, get off at Verona Puerto Nuova which is the main station, we got off the wrong one and ended up in a ghetto! It's best to do your homework before staying here to be sure you are aware of how far it is, we looked on google earth so we knew where to go for the bus etc. We got a taxi for 90 euros return to and from the Cruise Terminal which was very convenient as you are dropped right outside the terminal. It's well worth staying here and we would definately stay here again in the future if we visited again.

Reviews.Title: “I would give up space for better bed”
Reviews.Author: geethegreat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first experience in Italian accommodations. And it was a bit of a surprise. The room was large with two double or queen beds, a nice desk area, and a large bathroom. That is the best part. The worst - room key would not work and even after having it reprogrammed multiple times. The desk told us that it was because of our cell phones wiping it. (we didn't have cell phones with us?!) the bed was so lumpy/hard. Thankfully I brought sleeping medication or I would have been miserable. The food at the restaurant downstairs was quite delicious for both dinner and breakfast. Free wifi in the lobby - which was great!!! Location seemed good for being on the mainland. We were with a tourgroup so our transportation was taken care of already. If I went with a tourgroup that went here again I would be okay with it but I do not think I would choose to stay here on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kisskissboomboom Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel might be a lil far away from Venice Santa Lucia station, but I preffered it liked that. It was in main land but using bus it was easy to get there. The atmosphere is amazing. The stuff at reception desk was very helpful to guide us for Venice tours and different directions. Loved the room in the hotel. In a hot summer day in Venice u can use the Pool very well. Next time when I'm in Venice I know where to stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dullege
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the shining star in a series of junk hotels while on tour through Italy. This hotel had free wi-fi, a pool, exceptional bar and outstanding service from the staff. There is an excellent gym on the main floor that exceeded the previous hotels. Rooms were clean and spacious. It was very close to the main Venice area and made the travel easy. The hotel was very quiet and clean. I would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but located in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Cutie888
Reviews.Content: As with other hotels in the Novotel chain, Novotel Venezia Mestre is an elegant and modern hotel with clean and spacious rooms. The lobby area is nicely decorated and has lots of comfortable sofas for guests. There is also an internet corner in the lobby where one can surf for free and print boarding passes. Likewise, there is free wifi in the lobby (ask the staff for the password) but none in the rooms. The reception counter staff are very friendly and helpful, giving us information about the surrounding area and restaurants even without being asked. This was a welcome change from our experience in Lucerne where getting the reception staff to answer questions is like pulling teeth. The main downside to this hotel is its location. It is situated at Venezia Mestre, the mainland part of Venice and not Venice City itself with its lovely canals. To get to Venice, one has to take a bus or a train and cross a 5 km bridge. Unfortunately, the train station is far from the hotel, and the nearest bus stop is 10-15 minutes walk along a highway -- not a pleasant thing to do with the hot sun beating down your back. Furthermore, the hotel seems to be located in an industrial area surrounded by highways and unattractive concrete buildings, and definitely not near the centre of Venezia Mestre. The nearest supermarket (Lidl) is 10 minutes walk away while the nearest restaurant is at least 20 minutes walk. Because it was already late and the hotel was in the middle of nowhere, we decided to have dinner in the hotel restaurant instead of going into town and looking for a place to eat. This led to another unpleasant experience because apparently the other guests thought the same way and the restaurant was almost full. There were several wait staff standing around but none refused to take our order. They told us to wait for one of the waiters who was busy taking the order at another table. We could only surmise that only one of the wait staff speaks adequate English, as the other guests appeared to be tourists like ourselves and they were also impatiently waiting for the same guy. After being ignored for 15 minutes, my husband and I decided to venture out and eat elsewhere. We don't know what the problem was that night, but the wait staff should be able to accommodate a roomful of diners instead of just waiting for one guy to take all the orders. Especially since there were no other restaurants near the hotel, hence the guests would be more likely to dine within the premises. By the way, in their website the hotel stated that they run a shuttle service to transport the guests to and from Venice, but upon arrival, we learned that this was not true, so we had to take the bus. Another fail. Aside from the location and minor inconveniences described above, we had a lovely stay. Now that we know what to expect, we will probably take our meals before going back to the hotel and plan our schedule more carefully to allow for traveling time. Overall, this is a nice and clean place to sleep in after a hard day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Value of money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: a nice and clean hotel to stay for business and leisure. But the location is not good if you need public transport. It took too long for transport and waiting for bus. But the swimming pool looks good although I never tried.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: SaxofonHamburg
Reviews.Content: The hotel ist situated in Venezia Mestre, around 10 Minutes to the train station, near the highway, but not loud. The service is good, we only had some problems in the restaurant at night. At 10.30 pm the kitchen was already closed, but they say, that it is open until midnight! The quality-price-value is good. The breakfast was not bad, but too many people, the staff was not able to manage it all.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base to visit Venice”
Reviews.Author: Marion053 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ideal base to visit Venice for the day. There was a shuttle service from the hotel to Venice, and back again, at a very reasonable charge. You do need to book this, as there are limited times and seats available. The service here was excellent. On arrival, we experienced a misunderstanding with our booking which the manager immediately came out and dealt with in a very satisfactory manner. Sometimes problems occur which cannot be helped. As long as they are addressed appropriately, we (the customer) are happy and made to feel welcome. That was indeed the case in this instance. The hotel itself is very good with clean and well appointed rooms and a comfortable bed. There is also a pool area and outside terrace, which is a great place to have a drink at the end of a day of touring. We ate dinner twice at the restaurant. The first night the meals were of an acceptable quality, and the second night they were very good. Breakfast was very good by Italian standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel but transport into Venice can be difficult”
Reviews.Author: Plsugarman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent visit to Venice thinking it was a good way to visit the city and get more for our dollars. The hotel itself is very comfortable with a decent breakfast. Staff is fairly helpful. Unfortunately, getting into Venice and back proved to be difficult. The hotel's shuttle service is limited to morning and evening, which is way too restrictive. Also getting a 5 person taxi can be very difficult and expensive. Should be taken into account when contemplating staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tbiondi
Reviews.Content: Great service, comfortable room for a family of four. Delicious and generous breakfast. Convenient bus stop outside takes you right into Venice. Fun outdoor pool (unheated) which is fine in the summer. Would recommend for visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wery dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are used to stay at Novotels all around Europe. But we vwere wery disapointed with this hotel in Venezia. When I booked on the internet I wrote i wanted a Non smoking room. I got a smoking room and when I complained she said she was sory but I should have mentioned it when I arriwed. I have never mentioned it when I have arriwed at the other hotels. The room was so small that we almost couldn't walk around the bed. Breakfast was very caotic. When we ariiwed we vere told that they had bustickets at the hotel. But when we should use that service, they didn't have any left. So we needen to walk around in the area until we found a shop where they were selling them. There was free internet in the lobby. But it brooke down in the evening. So not very useful eather.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap the for room but extras added up”
Reviews.Author: JoSimister
Reviews.Content: We were traveling around Venice and stayed in this hotel on our first night. You can catch a bus from Marco Polo to Mestre, and then a local bus to a couple of hundred metres from the hotel. The walk from the bus stop to the hotel is short, but quite difficult as it is along main roads and there aren't crossing where you need them. The hotel was a bog standard business class hotel and the room price was cheap (Â£50). However, evening meal was expensive at Â£50 for one adult course, one children's meal and a half bottle of wine. Breakfast is also an extra 10 Euros. There is a pool at the hotel which was refreshing, but it was so full of splashy kids that you couldn't relax or swim in it. There are 2 computers in the lobby with free internet access but you should expect to queue for 30 minutes approx. The room was good and had tea/coffee making facilities (the only ones we came across on our trip even in Â£150+ per night hotels!) There is a bus to Venice Piazale Rome which leaves from about 200m from the hotel. The bus is busy. I wouldn't stay here again. The room price was good but they stung you for everything else and, as you're in the middle of a dual carriageway, there are no restaurants etc. to use as alternatives to the hotel. Nor does it feel like you're in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere if you have a choice”
Reviews.Author: snowpeople
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of our Trafalgar bus tour. The property and rooms are very nice but some of the staff can be quite rude. The wait staff in the restaurant were very good but their supervisor had a very bad attitude and it seemed like they were all scared of him.......made it seem like a tense work atmosphere. The front desk staff were good. The lifeguard was a bit of a bully yelling at the kids to get out of the pool and shoving some. One of the Trafalgar reps saw this and even complained to the hotel about it. If you have a choice, go elsewhere........I expected more from the Novotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Noce place but hotel in Manitenance !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and the staff very efficient and nice. Problem is to go to a hotel and the place is under maintenance and you get disturbed early in the morning by people refurbishing place !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the cocktails”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. The pool was closed even though it was about 25 C. The staff didn't have much of an idea about cocktails. I had the most bizarre martini I've ever had. Service was OK but no table service on terrace? Food was average. Reception staff were good. Easy to get into Venice centre. I've stayed in better and cheaper hotels. I expected more from a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Venezia Mestre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service in the hotel was very good, the attendants were very polite and always tried to help the guest. One thing that I didn`t understand was the reason that the swimming pool be open only for 11 am until 8 pm as many guests use to go to Venice during the day, it could open earlier or be open until 10 pm, maybe. But the worst thing that I faced in Novotel Venezia Mestre was the bed in the room. It was hard as a rock, and I asked to change my room, but the bed was alike the first one. Including, in the second night, I slept in the sofa, which was horrible but much better than the bed.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: daylate
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and friendly staff. Room size was good, location was ok.

Reviews.Title: “THE VIEW”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything one requires for venice,everything within stone throw.Good hotel,reception and very polite. Only problem faced in the room they have kettle,and coffee etc..but no milk. when asked for milk they charge u!!!bit of a bad show which ruined all the good work of the hotel CARLTON SYDNEY

Reviews.Title: “Really amazing...”
Reviews.Author: Shivang5
Reviews.Content: It was really good experience in venice.. Hotel staff helped to visit venice . They were really friendly. Hotel is near to the city centre and 3 days are enough for venice... Dont forget to have a romantic dinner at the riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel is the Name but nothing like a Novotel”
Reviews.Author: marlowstevens
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Novotels throughout the World but it just goes to show that with the wrong management sometimes, you cannot trust the brand. The room was dirty, the sink was blocked...a plumber was called, after which the room was unusable. Was allocated another room and then had to move without any staff assistance back and forth 200 metres at 10pm. Food was terrible. Staff attitude was the same. They even turned off the air-conditioning in the middle of the night...to save electricity they said.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but stay away from busy days!”
Reviews.Author: Easy_K
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was OK, the room was clean and we had enough space (3 adults sharing one room). The problem was that we stayed there during Easter weekend, which made our breakfast hell. We had to wait in line until we were assigned a table, and the breakfast staff was not very helpful (no "good morning", or "sorry for making you wait"), they were just in a rush, which was comprehensible, but one expects at least a smile. Once we sat down, we had to stand in line to get some coffee and bread etc.... my recommendation to the hotel team: coffee jugs on tables, it would have saved us sooo much time. There was a tour group that day, and they gave them "priority". We stood in line for about 10 minutes as we saw people pass before us just because they were in a tour group. Let's just say our day didn't start the best way that morning. The reception team was very nice and seemed to handle the amount of people fairly well. They spoke many languages and were very keen to give advice on where to go, what to do, etc. The internet is awfully expensive inside the rooms, so you should to go to the lobby if you want to use it (there's free wifi near the reception) It is true that the hotel is located far away from Venice, but we had a car so that wasn't a problem. There's a huge parking at the entrance of the city and you can leave your car for 25â‚¬ a day (sounds expensive, i know, but wait till you see how much they charge you for a meal in that city) Overall, I would recommend the hotel for a weekend getaway with your family. I don't think it's a very good place for business travelers as the internet is overpriced and breakfast takes too much time.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay for family with kids”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this hotel. The rooms are big enough for family with 3 kids, the oldest had very comfortable sofa bed and the little one (1 year old ) baby crib. The room was clean, with carpet floor, quite big bathroom with good hair dryer and enough towels. The location is perfect! Close to Venice and close to motorways to get anywhere else very quickly. The only one worst thing is that hotel is always full and that makes problem at breakfast time - full of people, dirty floor and not enough choice of food.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the hotel. The place was very nicely decorated and was a great value. The front staff very helpful and overall very nice. The place fairly close to the island of Venice so if you know your direction you should have no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, shame about the location...”
Reviews.Author: TickleOnTheTum
Reviews.Content: Booked: - Room for 2 adults with breakfast included. Purpose of Trip: - To visit Venice for sight seeing so basically needed somewhere to sleep as would be spending the day in Venice. Likes: - Clean rooms. - Modern furnishing. - Helpful reception staff. - Easy to get to Venice (hotel shuttle service or direct bus). - Tea and coffee facilities provided. Dislikes: - Bed was like sleeping on a plank. - Location is great if you have a vehicle but not so good if travelling by bus or train. - Main road to cross to get to hotel does not have a pedestrian crossing or foot paths so you risk being run over! - No shops or restaurants local except Lidl Supermarket (you have to travel to Mestre). - We found breakfast adequate but some people may find the choices small: for example, only 1 type of fruit and 2 types of cereal was offered. Would I Recommend: - Yes, if you have a car but only go by bus/train if you are not bothered by travelling as it is an awkward place to get to. Tips: - You have to purchase your ticket before you travel on the bus. If you ask the receptionist where to purchase a ticket they will probably send you to the tobacconist up the road. This is not necessary. Go the reception at the Air Hotel which is situated next door to the Novotel behind the petrol garage. Itâ€™s a lot nearer. - If you are using the trains at Mestre station and you canâ€™t read Italian, donâ€™t bother using the automatic ticket machines as they only translate into English up to a certain point then they revert back to Italian. Go to the ticket office. You may have to queue but it is worth it as they are very helpful. - When in Venice, it is a lot quicker to walk to places you want to go to than to catch a vaporetto. Vaporettos are very slow and stop at many stops but they are fun to ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always look forward staying at Novotels due to its quality but this one disappointed us in the breakfast, either for the variety of food that was offered as for the staff. I asked for a "cold chocolate milk" and it took 3 people to understand what I wanted. When finally someone understood, they brought me a powder for HOT chocolate, that didn't dissolve in the cold milk, of course. On the next day, i asked for an omelet, since there was basket of eggs and pieces of cheese and ham, that in the other hotels are used for the omelets. After 10 minutes, the server said that the couldn't do the omelet for me. The bread wasn't fresh and there was no sliced cheese and ham, only squares of it.

Reviews.Title: “a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: yvonne1216
Reviews.Content: We originally booked "All seasons" which was under the same chain hotel group. The deal for this newly open economic hotel was about 60 pounds a night for two people, including breakfast. We were happy when we got the e-mail, assuming it was kind of a upgrading. Everything was great, except location and breakfast was really disappointing...comparing with the same Novotel I stayed in Trabzon in Turkey. Only two hot food and no fresh coffee or tea was served. Feel it was worse than some youth hostels I have ever stayed....free 20 min internet per day per person

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a fair distance from Venice”
Reviews.Author: holidayfunMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Novotel Mestre â€“ Venice The hotel was very modern, clean and the service was excellent. My room was Room 128. It was a fair distance from the centre of Venice so didnâ€™t venture in at night. It reminded me of an â€œairport hotelâ€�..good facilities but in the middle of nowhere. I stayed at the hotel as part of a Trafalgar Tour group so we had dinner in the restaurant and breakfast which was delicious. Internet was available but at a charge. The pool area was very relaxing after a full day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stay was fine; only gripe is that the meal in the evening was expensive with small portions; had just run teh venice marathon

Reviews.Title: “A Big Letdown for a Novotel”
Reviews.Author: amak4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights however received a call from the hotel whilst sightseeing in Venice that we had to vacate as booking only for 1 day. It took many phone calls back and forth before the issue was settled... two separate bookings but under the same name. Now sufficient investigation by the hotel before stressing my family would have helped. However the hotel did try to make amends by putting in some complimentary fruit and slippers in the room. But damage done. Perhaps because we had realised by then that the hotel did not represent 'value'. Fair way away from Venice city, no shopping or cafes open on the weekend, also no free wi-fi. The hotel seems to cater mainly to the tour bus traffic. However we got everything else such as clean, big family rooms and courteous staff though getting one required a bit of a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not "in Venice"”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravelGal76
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is a standard 4 star hotel with standard ammenities and average rooms but is kind of in the middle of nowhere and not really "in Venice" as it's ~20 minutes drive to the port where you can take water taxis to Venice. Don't expect to walk to port and there is very little around the Novotel as it is right off the highway. That being said, the rooms were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with short distance from Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nikky_Berry Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you come to Venice by car - it's only 10 minutes to reach Piazzale Roma carpark in Venice where we can park our car and jump into vaporetto. Very clean room but not sound proof. Quite popular with tourist groups. Free internet only at hotel lobby with charges for WIFI. Free parking (optional).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: nmelis Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel I made a mistake and instead of booking for August (../08/2010) I booked for October (../10/2010). The personnel at the reception where very helpful they changed my reservation they helped me book another hotel because for one night there where no rooms free, without any extra charge. In high season, the Personnel at the reception and the policy of the hotel were EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ingleban
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with family (8 & 10 children). This is a good option for those not wanting to stay in Venice itself with the huge prices. We booked 2 rooms being conmcerned over room space but it turned out 1 room was very spacious, the staff were very accomodating in changing our booking. A fit couple could easily walk into Mestre but there is a bus stop right around the corner from the hotel with plently of buses going to either Mestre or Venice. The Hotel go out of their way to give you this information but neglect to mention bus tickets. You can buy them onboard for E1.80 (have the right money) or at a Tabac prior for E1.50. This Hotel seems to service a lot of large Bus Groups, consequently we found Breakfast a disaster. People everywhere, staff who didn't care what was happening and disgusting food, rotton fruit, stale breads, suspect cheeses and hams. The only safe items were the cereals and bottled water but the milk was warm. We had breakfast paid for on the 2 nights but didn't even bother with the second morning. This is a good, cost efficient option for anyone, just avoid the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Holland030
Reviews.Content: We had difficulties with the transport. We tried to take a buss from Venecia mestre to the hotel, but that did not worked out. As a alternative we went walking. It was a 35 min. trip. It feld like a 5 km walk. At night it was unpleasant because we had to walk under a viaduct, which we found scarry. When I went shopping in het big shopping center with the Carrefour and some outlet shops, I asked for a taxi. As an alternative they adviced me to take the hotel shuttel bus. They charged me 30 euro, which was way to much! I went back by bus (no 14, change at Mestre for the no 2). By bus it takes more then 30 min. to go back. It wil cost about 2 euro (you can buy a return ticket in the tabacco in the shoppingcenter). By taxi it is about 10 min. The pool was nice, but much to cold. The pool was supposed to be open untill 8 pm. But when I came at 7:45, the guy had allready closed the pool. He lauged about me and was unrespectful. He said that I were crazy to go for a swim at 7:55 (I still had 15 min. to go..!, it was 10 min. earlyer then that). The fact that I was approached unrespectfully made me angry. It had a negative impact on my stay. The reception staff was friendly and very professional. The breakfast was a bit poor (but breakfast standards might be different in a country as Italy). The coffee was not good, there was no dark/wholegrain bread, no fresh juice, no salmon or any other fish etc). It was 12 euro, which is not very expensice comparing to other hotels in Europe. The room was ok, but not as nice and new as other Novotel hotels I have seen in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Big and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hier0nimus Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mestre/Venice for one night during our trip with friends in Northern Italy. This was my fourth overnight stay in the same hotel. The hotel is rather industrial - big, no personal touch, and the location is surrounded with a web of highways. However, it offers the best that this kind of hotels can do: easily accessible from the main roads, clean, comfortable, huge rooms (for Italian standards), good LCD TV with solid choice of channels, courtesy coffee/tee tray, free parking space, efficient staff, shuttle bus to Venice every 30 minutes. The only remarks are: they should have Wi-Fi Internet and it should be free; the breakfast is too expensive. Going to Venice by car was a bit tricky, and the parking in Venice is a rip-off, taxi is even more expensive, so try to use the shuttle bus instead.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: EpsomDown Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff who must be sick and tired of telling people how to get to Venice but still were patient. Hotel fine, quite modern. Very functional, clean, and easy to find off motorway and drive into Venice Breakfast good, again helpful staff. Only blot was that desk staff misinformed us about Venice car parks, meaning we got charged â‚¬18 instead of â‚¬4 - so beware if you park in Tronchetto - read the charges carefully, not their fault and they were mortified!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Jewel in an Industrial Wasteland”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryMark42
Reviews.Content: Comfortable quiet room overlooking the outdoor swimming pool and in the distance a mess of roads and traffic. Our group was welcomed at reception, the suitcases were delivered promptly, everything worked in the room and the meals (buffet breakfast and evening meals on two days, pre-arranged) were good and varied. Not particularly Italian as the hotel obviously caters to tourists from everywhere. All our outside travel was in the tour coach so we did not have the concerns voiced by others, but the neighbourhood was singularly unattractive as seen from the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Hill
Reviews.Content: I stayed here sa part of a Trafalgar tour. The hotel itself is very nice, large rooms, well appointed, nice foyer, bar, restaurant and staff were helpful. The only reason it gets 3* is because of its location. If you are going to Venice (one of the best cities in the world) you must stay on the island itself. Its a simple as that. I think the hotel has a shuttle service but not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful meal and clean modern room”
Reviews.Author: ptitefunambule
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel (1 night) during a tour of Europe, Traditional Europe, organized by Trafalgar. We travelled as a group and I always shared a room with my boyfriend. This hotel is modern and clean. Our room was beautiful and moderate size. We had dinner and breakfast in the hotel. It was wonderful. The dinner was more like a meal that would be served in a fancy restaurant rather than in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth2000_10
Reviews.Content: I selected Novotel for my recent visit to Venice because I have had a good experience at Novotel hotels in Canada. However, Venice is a different story. If you rent a car to travel to Venice then Novotel would be a good choice. Otherwise, you are in for a lot of unpleasant surprises which will ruin your experience in the city. The hotel is located near a highway in the outskirts of Mestre. According to their website they provide a shuttle service but only when you arrive the staff let you know that the shuttle runs only twice per day at 9:30 a.m. and at 6:00 p.m. So, they offer you the possibility of taking the public bus (line Treviso) or bus #2 , and you have to take a 15 minute walk to the Tobacco shop to purchase the tickets for the bus. The bus runs all day but the last Treviso bus leaves Venice at 8:00 p.m. You can take line 2 but it leaves you on the other side of the highway and you have to make your way on foot over the overpasses where there is no sidewalk. That is indeed quite a challenge when you are traveling with children. They hotel offers its clients free tickets to a concert in downtown Venice. However, they only give you tickets for adults and if you have children you have to pay 20 euros per child. Our experience was even worse because on July 29th it rained cats and dogs and we had to venture into the streets, and catch busses that were usually late and Tobacco shop staff that were quite rude. Another unpleassant experience was to schedule a taxi to take us to the airport on July 30th. My friend booked the taxi on July 29th and we had to leave at 5:00 a.m. to make it in time to catch our flight back to Canada. When we arrived back to the hotel in the evening (July 29th) the staff us that another family was comming with us in the van. We were quite upset at the situation because they made that decision without consulting with us. The next morning, we realized that it was not a regular taxi but the shuttle bus. We were ready at 4:45 a.m., we checked out and we were ready to board the shuttle but the clerk advised us that we had to wait for the other family to be ready before we could leave. Finally at 5:20 a.m., and after a heated argument they agreed to take us to the airport without the other family. They charged us 45 euros to take us which is quite a rip-off considering that it was a 10 minute ride to the airport. The staff at the hotel is not helpful, and the maid came into my room announced while I was taking a shower. I consider that situation a total intrusion in my privacy and it shouldn't happen at all in a hotel that is supposed to be a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel in Mestre (not Venice!)”
Reviews.Author: Ballinora4
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel with clean, spacious bedrooms and excellent service. Staff were very friendly and helpful, for example allowing me to check in early at 930am after arriving from the US, and on departure calling the pre-arranged taxi to ask them to come a little earlier so I wouldn't have to wait. Buffet breakfast is good, and if you miss it they do a great coffee/juice/croissant breakfast until noon for just â‚¬6. I ordered room service from the restaurant and it was very good and not too expensive. Only negatives are: 1) the pool is small, has quite short opening hours, and not enough sunbeds 2) getting to Venice requires a 10 minute walk alongside a busy road and next to a stream with lots of mosquitoes; then a 20 minute bus ride. So not easy, especially if you are traveling with kids. 3) getting to Marco Polo Airport is an expensive taxi ride (â‚¬35-45) 4) very little within walking distance 5) no free WiFi

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel With A Pool”
Reviews.Author: Mountain-Biker-44
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a Trafalgar Family Tour. Rooms a little small but OK as they allowed 4 people per room. Great to have a pool for the kids to use. A little way away from the 'real' Venice and not actually on the Island itself. Overall good and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but you won't be walking to Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Kula762
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, modern hotel. Good sized, clean rooms with a decent bed. The room seemed new, nothing was worn out. It's only a short bus ride to Venice fromthe hotel, so it's convenient enough. The staff was friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay , not much to complain about”
Reviews.Author: doctorfoxtrot
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights at this hotel with my family and a large tour group. rooms are large compared to typical european standards, location of hotel is quite far from main island of venice, not much to see outside, some stores and food shops are 10-15 minute walk from hotel, extensive breakfast buffet but menu doesnt seem to vary day to day, what i appreciate about my stay was the happy and positive attitude of the staff in the coffee shop especially the one which i think has an african descent, he's really good i hope the food and beverage supervisor would not overlook his efforts

Reviews.Title: “Modern all the way”
Reviews.Author: yellowrose4606
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the outskirts of Venice but since we had transport to and from the canals of Venice there was not a problem. Bed was like sleeping on a box spring but other than that it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant if you're looking to save money”
Reviews.Author: greensidesch
Reviews.Content: We booked early & got the cheap room deal, including breakfast. Staff excellent, very good English. Buffet breakfast has loads of choice, even till last minute buffet things were being replenished. Rooms very clean & roomy, kids sofa bed made up already when we got there. About 3 min walk to the bus to Mestre, then change for bus to Venice. Shortest time was 25 mins, longest was about 45, depending on wait time for buses. Never waited longer than 10 min for a bus, excellent service. You have to buy bus tickets before getting on bus, so get at Mestre train station or most newsagents. We also went to Verona which was beautiful, well worth a visit, and only cost Â£35 for 2 adults, 2 kids, return on train, as long as get regional train & not express. The hotel also has a room where you can leave your luggage if you've a late flight, we picked up our luggage at 5pm after checking out, which made our last day so much less stressful. Staying here saved us a fortune, if you're looking for a romantic beautiful setting, you need to look elsewhere, however if you've got kids, & want to get good value for money, I'd recommend this hotel. I was very nervous about going to Venice, the guide books & internet made me think travel would be tricky & expensive, but that certainly wasn't the case.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: EvelineD
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 4 day trip to Venice and we stayed in this hotel. I chose it because of good experiences with the Novotel in Chiang Mai, and because of the price. It seems hard to find something decent in Venice under 150-200 euro's. We paid 89 euro's a night including breakfast, which I guess is cheap by Venice standards, but we usually stay in cheaper hotels like the Ibis so we expected more than that. Good things about the hotel are: the room is big, the bed soft, it's clean (although the bathroom smelled a bit odd), and breakfast is good (they do seem to serve the same items every day however, but we didn't mind as they had a big selection). There are some 'bad' points aswell. No major things, but when I add them all, it leads to the conclusion that the hotel didn't live up to our expectations and as far as I'm concerned we won't be staying there again. We arrived at the hotel at 11 PM. When we entered the room it felt like an oven and the airconditioning didn't work. When we mentioned this to the reception they just laughed in our faces and told us it's not switched on yet in April and maybe we could open the window (like the rest of the guests). This resulted in me still sweating my pants off, but my boyfriend was freezing. A lot has been written already about traveling into Venice. The bus stop is easy enough to find, as it's just around the corner, but buying tickets was a hassle. After asking where we could get them, the hotel gave us a map of the neighborhood with a Tabac on it, and told us to buy tickets there. After walking around in vain for 20 minutes it turned out there was no Tabac on the indicated place. Instead they could have just sent us to the small motel (Air Motel) right next door (behind the gas station) where they do sell them at the reception. There are two no. 2 Venice bound busses per hour, at .15 and .45 past the hour. The last bus from Venice (direction Treviso) leaves at 20.45h from stop B1. Busses can be crowded at times and the journey takes about 45 minutes. Please note that the hotel is also not in the center of Mestre. It's on the Northern outskirts next to the highway. If you want to find some restaurants, shops or an ATM, you have to walk for 15 to 20 minutes, so that's not very convenient. There is a LIDL supermarket next to the bus stop, which is open until 9 PM. We had another bad experience upon check out. We had to be at the train station in Mestre at 6.15 AM to take the ATVO airport bus to Treviso airport. We called the reception the evening before to confirm that the H2 bus would depart from the hotel to the train station that early in the morning already, as we had seen this on the time table at the bus stop. According to the receptionist there were no busses yet at that time, but he could call us a taxi. After checking out, the taxi was late, and when we got in it didn't turn out to be an official metered taxi, but just a guy (probably a friend of the receptionist who shares in the profits) with a van. After arriving at the station he tried to charge us 25 euro's for a 3 minute ride, a total scam! We paid 20 euro's in the end but that was still too much. And the good thing was, when we were waiting at the station, we saw the H2 and no. 2 bus drive by. I will certainly complain to the hotel about these 'practises'.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, even though not great location and a bit far from Venice”
Reviews.Author: francesco-1966
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, the room was very clean and rather large, and the breakfast was ok. Its location wasn't exactly great (right on a motorway exit) and the main problem was that getting to Venice was a bit difficult, and took almost one hour (we had to go to the Mestre train station by car, find a parking there, wait for a bus and ride it for about half a hour). One good point is that it was really unexpensive (we paid 80 â‚¬ for 2 aduilts + 2 kids). One VERY bad point is that we read that there was a shuttle to venice available, but actually there wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights while visiting Venice. The hotel is located about 14 kilometres from Venice. Rather than drive to Venice we opted for the cheap bus ride fro 1.10 euro each way, compared to 20 someting euro for a car park at Venice. The hotel is excellent in every way. The rooms are large and comfortable. The beds are also very comfortable. Breakfast was only barely adequate. Not good for a Novotel hotel. Car park is free, but limited spaces. Yes would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sayyedastrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed at tlhis hotel 2 adults and 2 children are 8 and 11. Room size good for sleeping and light relaxing. Very Very clean with speakers for sururound sound. Would stay at this hotel again. Is not fancy but good hotlel for short comfortable stay. Close to Venice if you have car and there is bus to take to Venice. Have stayed in this chain before but in barcelona would stay again at any citiy at this chain of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: sv1dkr
Reviews.Content: stayed there for one night but had to change hotel as it was smelly room and the staff was rude the least.Sorry to see this hotel going low as I had visited before 2 years ago and was happy but not now

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel poor service”
Reviews.Author: waley
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night either end of a 7 night cruise. Location is mid way between airport and Venice. Typical Accor, it sits in a "business park" next to the motorway. It's clean and tidy and well kept. Problem is it does not cater for it's customers. Web site boasts a shuttle bus to Venice. This does not exist. There are no tea making facilties on the first floor although this again is marketed facility. Breakfast service is appalling and the majority of staff ignorant and disinterested throughout the hotel. Only fun at breakfast was watching guests making up their pack ups for the rest of the day! I have used the accor chain a lot, mainly in France, and this only the second time I have had cause to complain. The other funnily enough was in Florence!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eks069
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Mestre Venice for 4 nights as a familt of 4 and it was wonderful. Clean well appointed rooms, friendly service, great little supermarket nearby, free internet access & shuttle bus to Venice. The only dissapointment was the restaurant, we had dinner there the first night and it was horrible. Otherwise all of this for 89euro per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location Venezia”
Reviews.Author: aussiescotts
Reviews.Content: Grab a bargain on the Novotel website with early break discounts. I picked this one up for 79 euro including breakfast for all four of us. Meals were well prices for dinner and also location to amenities was fantastic. About 200 metres walk was the bus stop to get to Venice and across that road was a supermarket to get your supplies. Parking available great staff easy to access. For room and price you could not get any better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and convenient hotel for family with small children”
Reviews.Author: meh1996
Reviews.Content: Located at a distance from main venice, novotel has great deals to offer families with young children. Children can stay free with parents and are also given free breakfast. We loved the deal. And i liked the place

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: Anj1969
Reviews.Content: Its a perfect hotel for families with small children as it does not charge for children. While its not located in main Venice, people should know that it is in a distant suburb called Mestre, some 25 to 30 mins away from the Venice bus depot

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, not so good location but with public transportation available.”
Reviews.Author: recunha
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during a trip to Italy. It is a great hotel, only con is the distance from Venezia, although public transportation is really easy to get. We got an offer of 79EUR per night, breakfast included, for Easter time. The hotel is a little bit far from Venezia, about 10Km. We took bus #H2 from Venezia Mestre Station to the Hotel (first stop in Terraglio Street, very easy to follow the stations). The bus stop is about 200m from the hotel. In the first day the paid hotel shuttle (EUR2,5 per way per person) to Venezia had already left (only once a day, at 9:00 and returning at 6:00). We then took again the bus "Venezia". To come back, we took the bus "Treviso". In the second day we booked in advance the shuttle for EUR5,00 per person for both ways. There is also a supermarket right after the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here thinking you will save money”
Reviews.Author: Rinaldo
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Novotel Mestre and had a good deal regarding the price ...reading the reviews from fellow travellers we though that we would be alright not staying in Venice itself. It turned out that the free shuttle service for Venice was not available and even if it had been it is coming back at 6pm at night!!! So we toook the bus (5/10mins walk away).....problem is the whole hotel did the same and what they don't mention is that there is a bus every 30 mins...that is if you can squeeze in!!! forget it if you travel with children and a pram! Commute from the hotel to Venice is a nightmare. If you stay at Novotel thinking you will save on the higher room rates on the 'island" itself you are wrong..unless you go to bed at 7pm and don't want to have dinner in Venice that's fine otherwise it will set you back 25 euros in taxi (last bus leaving Venice at 830pm!).Also do not use the internet it 's a complete rip off : 0,35 euros per min! The so called fitness centre is a broom cupboard... The hotel itself is fine, staff not very helpful but breakfast is good! Also the hotel is located next to a motorway...it literally broke my heart to leave the splendid surrounding of Venice to go back there. it felt like we made a huge mistake and definitely took most of the magic away!!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Piersicuta
Reviews.Content: So, I stayed at Novotel for 3 nights. i'll write here what i would have liked to find out myself before leaving. Getting to Novotel: From Treviso, you take the airport bus and you get off at the first station. Then take another bus which has Treviso written on it and ask the driver for the station for Novotel. When you reach the station, get off, cross the street, and walk straight ahead for 10 meters and then turn left. As you turn left you will be able to see the hotel on the left side, it's a red building. The hotel: The rooms are fantastic, big, you have a huge double bed and a sofa. The bathroom is big, with a tub. The area is not noisy, although it's close to the highway. There is no balcony but you have tea/coffee facilities in the room, minibar and heating. They only have outdoor pool and sort of a fitness center, but it's really small. The breakfast is between 6 30 and 9 30. You have ham, cheese, yoghurt, cereals, milk, butter, 4 different kinds of bread, croissants, nuttella, jam.. It's a good place for people on a diet, they have oat bread, fruits, omlette, boiled eggs, orange juice, coffee, tea. This hotel is a good choice, and most important it's really a 4 star hotel. It has maps at the reception, the receptionist speaks English very well, and it's eager to explain how to get to Venice or some other part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 45DegreesNorth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. We were on a Globus family tour that ended in Venice. I was a bit disappointed first that our hotel was not on the island of Venice, but once there, all was fine. All of our transportation was arranged for us so we didn't notice. When you move in a group and you are enjoying it, you don't mind. The trip back and forth into Venice by boat was something that we really enjoyed. What really makes this hotel is the pool scene, which is just beautiful. There is a bar just off the pool so you can enjoy a drink on the tables by the pool and watch the kids play in the water. We had a lovely evening of the kids relaxing and playing by the pool, enjoying a gorgeous sunset, and talking with new friends that we made on our trip. Upon reflection, this was the perfect scene for our 7 year old son. This hotel is clean, modern, spacious. The breakfast was very good, the service was just fine. Rooms large, bed comfortable. The lobby and attached lounge area is a nice spot to relax and meet up with fellow travellers - it is very bright and lovely when the sun is setting. There is a video game station close to the end of this section - if you were sitting in the lounge area and you had kids, you could sit in one place and view your kids at the play station or in the pool. Very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from Venice but a comfortable stay and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jesse1834
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights during my Italy and Greece Trafalgar trip. Although not much is located around the hotel the staff and cleanliness of the hotel were pretty excellent. The rooms were large and the beds comfortable. The food in the restaurant was excellent, a great value if you just don't want to fool with trying to stay in Venice. Staying in the main part of Venice looked like a royal pain in the butt.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: alicja29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel in Mestre for 3 nights in September 2008, I'd been working in Mestre for two weeks and living with a host family and my mum came out to visit me when I'd finished working. We paid 76 euros a night for a superior double. The room was nice, clean modern with good air con. The hotel is the typical standard you would expect from novotel and the staff spoke excellent english (and I'm an english teacher!). The breakfast was good with a wide selection of hot and cold with lots of fresh fruit. Drinks in the bar were cheap 2 euros for a glass of wine, although you did have to pay to use the internet. The rooms were cleaned daily and tv had english channels. I never used the shuttle service but there is a bus to venice about 2 mins walk from the hotel, you need to buy a ticket from a tabac they usually give you a card which you then top-up and scan on the bus (1.10 euro). The hotel is a 15 min walk from the main square in mestre which is really nice to go for drinks, although do avoid the bar right by the fountain as the drinks are twice the price! Only criticism of the hotel was on the last day when they ordered us a taxi, we wanted to go to the main square a 5 min drive, the driver took us on a HUGE loop of the town and then tried to charge us 15euro! Having previously taken a taxi to the hotel and paid 5 euros for it I complained to the driver and was charged this.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but not an outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: dognamedrudy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in many Novotel hotels during a 3-week trip to Europe. This Novotel, just outside of Venice had nice rooms and was a reasonably good value for our family of four, but was nowhere near the value of some of the other Novotels where we stayed, particularly the one in Munich. Pros: -- Clean room. -- Reasonable rate for famiy of four (we booked in advance by Internet). Cons: -- Advertised shuttle into Venice was *never* available. We stayed three nights in this hotel and were not able to book a ride into Venice during any of those days as the shuttle (which must have been very limited in size & schedule) was completely booked the entire time. Thankfully we had a car. -- Breakfast was poor, particularly when compared to the Novotel in Munich. -- Service during breakfast was virtually non-existent. We had to ask for coffee and then ask for cream/sugar/etc. -- Computers offered in the reception area were "out of order" during our entire stay. (In Novotel Munich, both computers were operating and offered free Internet access.) -- Playstation in the Kids Area was not functioning.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but a little far from venice...”
Reviews.Author: cricri003
Reviews.Content: A good Novotel hotel. It lives up the expectations. Surpriseless, since it's a Novotel. The front desk was helpful, but a bit distant. My room was confortable, and clean. The hotel restaurant was good, but pricey. However, the hotel remains a bit far from Venice. It has a free shuttle service to Venice. You will need to book a seat in advance at the front desk. Yet, shuttles are often full, and you may have to take public transport instead...Bus stop is not far away from the hotel. Not sure I'll be returning though....

Reviews.Title: “Very busy hotel, lots of tour groups, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: franrich08
Reviews.Content: Nice location - we had a room overlooking the swimming pool. No complaints with the room. However, it was a very busy hotel with a number of tour groups booked in (including ours) and we had all groups wanting to have breakfast at the same time so that they had trouble keeping up with the food supply. However, the evening meal we had there was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “There should be a better place in Mestre”
Reviews.Author: peteclark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a three day add-on Venice excursion by Legendary Journeys. We had no problem with location, as it was a low cost alternative to central Venice. However, the room was postage stamp size - I mean really small. Staff was barely responsive to simple requests, such as ice (has the formula been lost in Europe?). Cleanliness was marginally acceptable, just clean enough to make one wonder. The hotel restaurant was fine for the free breakfast, but dinner was expensive and not very good -why is that?
