Overall, our Venice experience would have been better if the travel agent had booked a better property and jacked up the price accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “good option to visit Venezia”
Reviews.Author: cred68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I staye at Novotel Venezia Mestre only for one night but it was a economic and good option to visit Venezia.The hotel is a Novotel standart, modern, good size room and bathroom.The staff is ok.The breakfast is good.The parking lot is free of charge.The only problem was the "free transfer to Mestre train station and to Piazzale Roma in Venezia".This transfers is not for all Novotel guests and you need to book it (I donÂ´t know how many hours,days,weeks before )but we really didn't find any concern about it. It was ok, we walked 2,5 kms to Mestre train station.If you have some problems about walking please, be carefull because it is not so near.Well, I recommend this hotel if you donÂ´t want to spend lots of money at Venezia expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Can a pool BE SOOOOOOOOOO cold?!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: familymanParis
Reviews.Content: Swimming pool was main reason for choosing this hotel ...but the architect put it in a place where it gets almost no sun ,,,,and it is unheated. Also, not enough information is provided by the hotel. We missed the shuttle to Venice for our first 2 days, 1st time we didn't know we had to book 2nd time we tried to book but hadn't been told that you have to book the morning before!!!! Shame, because design of hotel is great inside, family area is good and staff are superb ...

Reviews.Title: “correct choise”
Reviews.Author: familySwitzerland
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with nice rooms, especially for families. We had a very reasonable pricing for a 4 person room. The breakfast was much more better than we expected. There is a shuttle bus to Venice but do not forget to book in advance. if you miss the shuttle or can not find a place (which is possible during the high season) taxi costs 20-25 Euro. There are some free parking places around the hotel (very safe) and they charged us 6 Euro per night which was really cheap. Personel was not very helpful which you should be ready during your visit to Venice. We definitly will stay again at this hotel if we visit venice in the future

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay In Venice????”
Reviews.Author: lakebrats
Reviews.Content: O.k. folks why would you stay directly in Venice and pay those prices when you can have free breakfast free shuttle into venice and free parking?? If you have a family and are looking for a cheap comfortable place to stay while visiting venice look more more! the breakfast is great rooms are clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Venice area”
Reviews.Author: Wiener SÃ¤nger
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best value hotel in the Venice area. It has a shuttlebus to Piazalle Roma in central Venice. You have to take No. 5 bus to get to Piazalle Rome from the airport. From there, any bus saying "Treviso" will stop 40m from the hotel, the name of the halt is "Terraglio". After this bus stops, you have to take a no. 2 and get off at "Ospedale". From there it is about 0.4km walk. The La Terrazza restaurant has a reasonably good menu, but as with anything in Venice, don't expect it to be cheap. The rooms are of decent size and quite comfortable, with an electric kettle and fridge. The beds are real King doubles (standard Novotel), and there is a sofa in the room too. It was nice ot meet a waiter from back home in the restaurant. Overall, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ernavandeven
Reviews.Content: last weekend we spent 2 nights at this hotel. it is a modern hotel outside the centre of mestre. the rooms are quite large, clean with a nice bathroom. the hotel looks quite new. breakfast buffet is ok but nothing special. quite a lot of groups stay at the hotel. the hotel offers free shuttle service to venice. notice you have to book it in advance ( we didn't when we checked in; in the morning it turned out that the bus was fully booked. the busstop of the publictransportsystem is a five minutes' walk but the bus was full so it didn't stop . finally we managed to take a taxi ( cost 20 euro). the public transportsystem allows to come back untill after midnight. the price is included in the vaporettafare.(watertransport in venice). we can recommend this hotel- we paid an average price of 125 euros per night - but if we ever would return we would prefer to stay in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Adventures of Venezia”
Reviews.Author: El_Gato07
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews about the hotel and wasn't sure what to think, but our experience was great. The Hotel is decorated very nicely, and it is very clean. The staff are friendly and helpful and they speak english. A breakfast buffet is included with the stay (Upscale continental). The rooms are small but clean and we actually had a bathtub in our room but I did see the hole that the other reviews spoke about, so we were lucky on that part. The hotel is nicely located, a bus stop is about 200m away and it's only a 15 min trip. Save time and buy the passes from the hotel for the bus and water bus in Venezia. Explore the canals by foot or water bus. The Gondolas are way too expensive. There is some great shopping in the area with alot of good places to eat. You have got to try the Spritz and the Belleni (drinks). This was a famiy trip and we had a ball.

Reviews.Title: “Good last min find”
Reviews.Author: pokeystar
Reviews.Content: I was given a free flight ticket at the last min to new year in Venice, while I jumped at the chance finding a hotel was difficult. I found this hotel online and booked. It is situated quite a way out of the tourist centre of venice and a taxi ride in cost about 25 euro. While there was a shuttle bus I was in too much of a party hurry to wait. Bed was very cosy and breakfast good if a little manic (it was new years day lots of sore heads and everyone hit the resturant for the last possible sitting). Rooms clean and very quiet, likewise bar vey quiet certainly not a spot for a wild night out. But if your stuck certainly a usable base in a clean pleasent hotel. Very handy for Marco Polo airport!

Reviews.Title: “Traffic galore but good artichoke salad!”
Reviews.Author: Queenston
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this hotel as part of a conference I was attending just outside Venice. I have stayed in Novotels before (particularly in Toronto), and I would say this was about on a par with my previous experience in North America. The major disadvantage is that if you are a walker, there is no place to walk very easily or safely due to the rampant traffic around the hotel--definitely only a place to stay if you are travelling by car. (My colleagues staying at the Michaelangelo liked it much better in terms of the walking issue, and I expect I would stay there if I were to return to Venice again.) But the hotel shuttle bus was great and never busy when I needed it--I just booked the night before. The evening meals were good, with use of local produce in season (eg. procini mushrooms, baby purple artichokes) and changing menus. The breakfast buffet was ok but not great by North American standards, but actually quite good by Italian standards as it had hot items (bacon and eggs). My reference point is having spent about 8 weeks travelling in Italy over the past number of years. I also noted the problems wiith breakfast serving staff; my coffee drinking colleagues were often in a state of agitation by the time the coffee finally appeared! My hotel room was clean, the bed comfortable, the walls soundproofed so you did not hear the traffic from the many freeways, and the bathroom nicer than any I have previously experienced in Italy in hotels that had a higher nightly rate. The service from the staff was reasonable and at the same level I had experienced on previous trips to Italy. But many North Americans might not be aware that is the usual approach to service in Italy where life is lived in a different, less hectic manner. An exception was the evening host in the restaurant who ran around constantly to be sure he had things in hand. So, all in all, it is a functional hotel that is reasonably priced but it is certainly not for walkers..

Reviews.Title: “To expensive”
Reviews.Author: linthorpelad
Reviews.Content: Handy location if you are coming in on the main A4/E55 not so handy for any restaurants or local life. The hotel is a new building with good facilities, bedrooms are a good size and very clean, however this hotel is the same as many in Mestre to expensive. Internet is charged for and they have no English newspapers on a weekend

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamilya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 06 and we found the room we stayed in the hotel modern and clean, it appears to be recently built. Was travelling with our two young children so found Novotel an excellent value for 4 people as they allow kids to stay free (pullout double bed provided) The location from what we can tell is on the outskirts of Mestre, when you initially get there it appears to be in the middle of nowehere when the taxi drops you off, you don't see much but a freeway and a petrol station... however a short 10 minutes walk away are the shopping areas near the hospital where you can find decent restaurants and other shops (walk around the corner past the petrol station and then turn right and keep walking past the bus stop and trough the underpass and you will suddenly see shopping areas, don't turn right like I did, you just end up around a military base in a quiet resedential neighbourhood where you won't find any places to eat or ATMs!) the food prices seem cheap but they hit you with the drinks, but overall find it still cheaper to eat out there than Sydney... so I think the restaurants outside provide excellent value... not so for the restaurant in the hotel the servings are quite small and more expensive than the outside as you would expect, they always charge a premium for in hotel restaurants.. so if you don't mind the walk I recommend you eat out for a bit of variety and better value. The hotel provides an excellent buffet breakfast (included in the price of the stay) nice hot food, fresh juices, fresh bread, fresh fruit, cereal varities... gives you a good start for the day... The hotel is about a 20-30 minute bus ride into Venice , they provide a shuttle bus which gets fully booked all the time so you have to book a day or two in advance (eg. if you arrive this afternoon and want to go to venice tomorrow you are unlikely to get a spot)... the good news is there is a bus stop around the corner and the bus will take you to Venice for 1 Euro ... one tip though, the buses don't sell tickets on board so you must buy your tickets beforehand available at newsagents, petrol stations and the main bus ticket office in Venice itself.... Getting to the hotel is not the easiest as it's not close to Mestre train station (if like us, you are coming by train) , you will have to take a taxi from Mestre train station and pay about 10 euros to get to the hotel. The hotel provide maps of Mestre and Venice... the staff are polite and helpful however the hotel was very busy at that time we're there so you may end in the queue at times which is understandable.

Reviews.Title: “Not too clean”
Reviews.Author: MM69
Reviews.Content: The location was OK for us since we didn't want to stay in Venice. A free shuttle took us from Novotel to the main plaza to Venice entrance, about 15min-nice service. The smell on the hallways was strange (couldn't identify) and the room wasn't too clean. Blankets on the beds were old and smelled bad. The extra bed wasn't elegant at all, had metal edges/corners which could very easily hurt if you were not careful, plus not too much room left to walk around. Staff was OK and breakfast too. I believe 4 stars is too generous for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: stonefam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and comfortable however is poorly located. It is situated next to a busy onramp for a major highway intersection. Access from the airport [Marco Polo] is advertised as a 25 Euro taxi fare however our fare was 40 Euros both ways on a meter. If you wish to experience the atmsphere of a different culture and lifestyle then this is not the place to stay. It is a 20 minute walk via busy roads with no footpaths from any other civilisation in Mestre. The hotel shuttlebus to/from Venice is very good however doesn't allow you any flexibility. The restaurant in the hotel provides adequate meals however with no atmosphere. The nearest restaurant outside is excellent with great value for money dining in a very good atmosphere however can only be reached via a poorly lit walk on a busy road through an underpass that reeks of urine. There are many other hotels in Mestre at a similar price however they are in better locations. Internet access is provided on contract by 2 providors. It is problematic and very expensive unless you sign up as a long term customer. The hotel is promoted as 4 stars however I feel that is a little overrated. In the Accor chain it should be branded as an Ibis rather than a Novotel standard.
